episodeTitle: The Hero of Arabasta and the Ballerina on Deck
episodeTitleJapanese: アラバスタの英雄と船上のバレリーナ
episodeTitleRomanized: Arabasuta no Eiyū to Senjō no Barerīna
description: The Straw Hat crew rescues a mysterious stranger from the sea who turns out to be Mr. 2 Bon Kurei, a Baroque Works officer agent. Meanwhile, in Arabasta, Crocodile demonstrates his power by eliminating a pirate crew terrorizing Nanohana.

events.title: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei's First Appearance
events.description: The Straw Hat crew accidentally catches Mr. 2 Bon Kurei while fishing in the fog. They rescue him from drowning, not knowing he is an officer agent of Baroque Works.
events.significance: Introduction of one of the most beloved characters in One Piece, setting up both an antagonist relationship and an eventual deep friendship. This chance encounter becomes crucial to the Arabasta Arc's conclusion.

events.title: Mane Mane no Mi Demonstration
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei demonstrates his Devil Fruit ability, the Mane Mane no Mi, by transforming into various members of the Straw Hat crew. He touches their faces with his right hand to copy their appearance, and touches his own face with his left hand to return to normal.
events.significance: First introduction of the Clone-Clone Fruit's abilities in the anime. This ability becomes a major plot point both as a threat and later as a crucial aid to the Straw Hats. The demonstration reveals the fruit's mechanics and limitations.

quotes.text: I can copy anyone whose face I touch with my right hand!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei
quotes.context: Demonstrating his Devil Fruit ability to the crew

events.title: Vivi Sees Her Father's Face Copied
events.description: During Mr. 2's demonstration of his copying ability, Vivi notices that he has copied her father King Cobra's face at some point, revealing that Baroque Works has infiltrated the highest levels of Arabasta.
events.significance: This revelation heightens the stakes for Vivi and shows how deep Baroque Works' infiltration of Arabasta goes. It foreshadows future impersonation plots.

events.title: Sanji Remains Uncopied
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei is unable to copy Sanji's face because Sanji was in the kitchen during the demonstration. This becomes a crucial detail that will help the crew later.
events.significance: Sanji being in the kitchen and missing the face-touching moment creates a key advantage for the Straw Hats, as Mr. 2 cannot impersonate him. This detail becomes strategically important in future encounters.

events.title: Discovery of Mr. 2's True Identity
events.description: Mr. 2's ship arrives to rescue him, revealing his swan-themed vessel and his status as an officer agent of Baroque Works. The Straw Hats realize they've been befriending an enemy agent.
events.significance: The revelation creates dramatic irony as both parties realize they are enemies, yet they've already formed a genuine connection. This sets up the complex friendship-rivalry dynamic that defines Mr. 2's relationship with the crew.

events.title: Zoro's Counter-Plan
events.description: As the Going Merry approaches Arabasta, Zoro devises a plan to counter Mr. 2's disguising ability, suggesting they use a marker or identifier that Mr. 2 cannot replicate.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's tactical thinking and foreshadows how the crew will deal with the threat of impersonation in future encounters.

events.title: Puppu's Introduction
events.description: In Nanohana, pirate captain Puppu and his crew are shown looting and terrorizing the town, taking advantage of the civil war chaos in Arabasta.
events.significance: Establishes the lawlessness in Arabasta due to the civil war and sets up Crocodile's 'hero' demonstration.

events.title: Pell and Chaka Head to Nanohana
events.description: Pell, Chaka, and other royal guards are shown riding horses toward Nanohana to deal with the pirate threat.
events.significance: Introduction of key Arabasta guardians and showing the kingdom's response to the pirate threat.

events.title: Crocodile Appears as Arabasta's 'Hero'
events.description: Crocodile suddenly appears on a rooftop in Nanohana. The townspeople recognize and call out to him as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, seeing him as their protector.
events.significance: Establishes Crocodile's public image as Arabasta's hero, contrasting with his true role as the arc's main antagonist. This duality is central to the Arabasta Arc's conspiracy plot.

events.title: Crocodile Defeats Puppu and His Crew
events.description: Puppu insults Crocodile as a 'government dog,' prompting Puppu's crew to attack. Crocodile allows them to stab him with their swords, but uses his Logia intangibility. He then creates a sand twister that dehydrates Puppu and his entire crew, killing them instantly.
events.significance: First major demonstration of Crocodile's deadly Sand-Sand Fruit powers in the anime. Establishes him as a ruthless and overwhelmingly powerful antagonist while maintaining his 'hero' image to the public.

quotes.text: Anyone who does not wish to die should lay on the ground.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Warning to bystanders before executing Puppu's crew

quotes.text: You sold yourself to authority! You're the World Government's dog!
quotes.speaker: Puppu

events.title: Nanohana Citizens Cheer for Crocodile
events.description: After eliminating the pirates, the citizens of Nanohana celebrate Crocodile as their hero and protector, completely unaware of his true machinations behind the civil war.
events.significance: Reinforces the tragic irony that Crocodile is secretly orchestrating the very chaos he appears to be protecting Arabasta from. Shows how effectively he has manipulated public perception.

events.title: Straw Hats Approach Arabasta Coast
events.description: The Going Merry approaches the coast of Arabasta, marking the crew's arrival at the kingdom that will be the setting for one of One Piece's most important arcs.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of the Arabasta Arc proper, one of the most beloved and pivotal arcs in One Piece. This arc will test the crew's resolve and cement their bonds.

quotes.text: I can copy anyone whose face I touch with my right hand!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei

quotes.text: Anyone who does not wish to die should lay on the ground.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile

quotes.text: You sold yourself to authority! You're the World Government's dog!
quotes.speaker: Puppu

themes.description: The episode explores how appearances can be deceiving through both Mr. 2's copying abilities and Crocodile's false hero persona.
themes.symbolism: Mr. 2's Mane Mane no Mi represents the theme of false faces, while Crocodile's public heroism masks his villainous intent.

themes.description: The Straw Hats befriend Mr. 2 before learning he's an enemy, establishing a complex relationship that transcends simple ally/enemy dynamics.
themes.symbolism: The chance meeting in the fog symbolizes how genuine connections can form in unexpected circumstances.
culturalReferences: Okama culture and the Way of Okama that Mr. 2 follows

themes.description: Crocodile uses his power to maintain a hero image while secretly orchestrating the chaos he claims to prevent.
themes.symbolism: The contrast between Crocodile's public image and private actions represents political manipulation and propaganda.

characterSpotlights.role: Debut and comic relief with ominous undertones
characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a flamboyant, friendly character with a dangerous Devil Fruit ability. His genuine kindness to the crew despite being an enemy agent establishes the complexity of his character.
keyActions: Rescued by the Straw Hats from drowning
Demonstrates Mane Mane no Mi powers
Befriends the crew while unaware they are enemies
quotes: I can copy anyone whose face I touch with my right hand!

characterSpotlights.development: Establishes his role as both Arabasta's 'hero' and a ruthless villain. His power and cunning are on full display.
keyActions: Allows Puppu's crew to stab him
Uses sand powers to kill Puppu and his entire crew
Maintains hero image with the townspeople
quotes: Anyone who does not wish to die should lay on the ground.
You sold yourself to authority! You're the World Government's dog!

characterSpotlights.development: Her recognition of her father's face among Mr. 2's copies heightens her anxiety about the conspiracy threatening her kingdom.
keyActions: Recognizes her father King Cobra's face among Mr. 2's copies
Realizes the depth of Baroque Works' infiltration

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates strategic thinking by devising a counter-plan to Mr. 2's disguise ability.
keyActions: Devises plan to counter Mr. 2's copying ability
Prepares the crew for arrival at Arabasta

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some of the comedic scenes with Mr. 2 demonstrating his abilities, adding more reaction shots from the crew.
The scene with Crocodile defeating Puppu includes more detailed animation of the sand twister and dehydration effect.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the beginning of the Arabasta Arc, which is one of the longest and most beloved arcs in One Piece.
Mr. 2 Bon Kurei is one of the few antagonists to become a genuine friend to Luffy, making multiple sacrifices for him throughout the series.

sources.title: Bon Clay is One Piece's Most Lovable Side Character

trivia.fact: The episode achieved a TV rating of 16.3% in Japan, ranking 3rd for its time slot.
Kazuki Yao, who voices Mr. 2 Bon Kurei, is known for his ability to portray eccentric characters with both comedic and dramatic depth.
The opening song 'Believe' by Folder5 and ending song 'BEFORE DAWN' by Ai-Sachi were both popular during this era of One Piece.
This is the first episode to feature Nanohana, a port town based on ancient Egyptian architecture.
